column1: Fix the script error in the ama-es-ch system on production
column27:
Hello Codebusters,

when I checked our engine logs on kibana prod I noticed the occurrence of multiple rg.graalvm.polyglot.PolyglotException in the oebb-test system.

*org.graalvm.polyglot.PolyglotException: TypeError: Cannot read property 'split' of null*

The cause seems to be that the object minDate is set to null by configuration.getCalculationSetting(...) in the instance of the exception. Generally this code snippet can be found in the last script of the expenseData hook of the validation phase. 
A null-check before any further operation on minDate  should fix the problem.

- System: oebb-test
- Country: AT
- Phase/Hook: validation/ExpenseData
- Subactor: net.ifao.expense.logic.customSubActors.CustomScriptSubActor
column221: 09/Mar/23 11:18 AM;tsteinhaeuser;Sorry for the typo in the title.;;;

column1: Allianz - Change the approval behaviour
column27:
Dear Team,

 

Allianz would like to change a bit the approval behaviour for the locations DE-Allianz Beratungs- und Vertriebs AG.

 

Today all statements need to be approved and after audited before to be exported for reimbursement.

Allianz would like to remove the approver and auditor process for all statements with amount less or equal to 20€.

 

1. Option

User submits the statement without approver and auditor.

The statement will be automatically approved and paid out.

 

2. Option

User submits the statement without approver and auditor.

The statement will be automatically sent to a group mailbox.

Allianz will implement a robotic KI behind this group mailbox.

Approval will be done by KI.

The statement will be paid out.

 

I assume the first option is easily feasible but not sure for the second option requested.

If this last is not feasible, please could you give me the reason (request from Allianz).

 

Please let me know also how many manday is needed it.

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column170:
Server: amadeus
System: ama-de-allianz
Location: All DE-Allianz Beratungs- und Vertriebs AG

column1: Replace deprecated GBO calculator
column27:
The GBODomesticPerDiemCalculator has been deprecated a long time ago and gbo is already migrated to the EMS. As it seems, it was missed to replace this calculator during migration.

The calculator itself performs a configuration switch based on the condition if a trip covers multiple or just a single day. Replacing this calculator and therefore removing the configuration switch will speed up the calculation by about 250ms.

*How to replace:*
A new perdiem block needs to be added which replaces the old blocks with attributes multipleDays and singleDays. This block will define the base perdiem.
In the custom logic block the calculator can be replaced by the subsequent execution of FindPerDiemDE, PerDiemTripLengthModifier and StorePerDiem.
In the PerDiemTripLengthModifier the fullTrip parameter needs to be enabled.
Based on the defined base perdiem the modifications table can be configured (dayCount=1/2) together with the operation to match the previously used perdiem blocks for single or multiple days.

column1: Amadeus: perdiem calculation for trip to Madrid from Amadeus SAS FR
column27:
Dear Team,

 

We noticed that when the first day of trip (departure day) has 2 different countries there is an error in perdiem calculation when the subsidized is ticked

!image-2023-02-22-13-25-14-471.png|width=518,height=74!

1/ good calculation if there is no break between Nice and Madrid trip as below:

!image-2023-02-22-13-19-37-039.png|width=563,height=221!

2/ wrong calculation if there is break between Nice and Madrid trip as below:

!image-2023-02-22-13-21-20-908.png|width=543,height=219!

 For this second example we must to have the same calculation as first now.

Please, could you check this issue?

Thans in advance!

 

BR

Karolina
column170:
AMADEUS-C: ama-es-amadeus
FR - Amadeus S.A.S., Sophia Antipolis
column222:
08/Mar/23 4:38 PM;kgostynska;Hi [~jtkacz] :)

Daily per diem is 40 EUR for France/Spain - in the first example, user didn't have a break between localisations (france/spain) and cytric counted per diem as a half of daily per diem (1/2 of 40 EUR) which is 20 EUR - and this should apply until end of the day.
In the second example, user had a break, and cytric counted it as 2 daily per diems - in 1 day (2/13/23) - 1/2 of half per diem for France and 1,5x daily per diem for Spain - which is wrong. User can't have 2 perdiems in 1 day.

If there is even 1 minute brake the per diem should equal 0?  - Yes, for 2nd country = 0, if the user received per diem in the same day for first country.

I hope is more clear now :)

BR
Karolina;;;

column1: Porsche AT: region missing for some countries
column27:
Dear Team,

I hope you do well!

 

After Porsche complained that some regions for countries are missing in the itinerary - we have checked the statutory and attached file and found out that all countries in green need to have specific regions.

 

Please, could you set up the region missing. For your information, "border" (grenzorte) must be mentioned as a city in the region file.

 

Thank you in advance!

 

Best regards,

Milosz

column1: Create a new conditional approval workflow
column27:
h3. User Story

*As a*

user

*I want to be able to*

have specified conditional workflow

*So that* 

I can follow my respective process of approving and auditing within my company
h3. Acceptance Criteria

Create a new approval workflow base on "WfProcDefPlugin-WfProcessExpenseBasic.jar".

Add logic that will send each statement with a total amount lower than 500 directly to the export process. Statement between 500 and 1000 directly to the auditing process. The rest statements (over 1000) should undergo whole workflow (approvals and auditing).

column1: Add custom logic
column27:
h3. User Story

*As a*

user

*I want to be able to*

have customized validators in the system

*So that* 

I can have defined my own specific validators preventing from inappropriate creation of my statement
h3. Acceptance Criteria

Please create custom logic:
 * Add custom validation in location Nice HQ for mileage allowance, only kilometers are allowed, distance units in miles should retrieve error message:
 ** Error message on expense and receipt level:
EN: "You should set the mileage in Kilometers. Using Miles is not permitted."

 * Add custom validation in Hannover HQ and Poznan HQ locations for vehicle registration plate. When mileage is provided the FDF "Vehicle name" is mandatory:
 ** Error message on expense and absence level:
EN: "Please provide vehicle name."

*Note!* Custom scripts can be written only with interfaces. Therefore a subactor CustomScriptSubActor has to be used to retrieve logic.

user

List of default validators available on the following [link|https://rndwww.nce.amadeus.net/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=CYT&title=List+of+available+Subactors].

System level:

21/Feb/23 10:00 AM;nsanchez;client notes>

For clarification:

1) If the company pays the costs, then it must be mapped to a wage type starting with 9.

In this example, the company pays for the flight. This means that the correct wage type is 961Z. There are no alternatives with regard to sales tax.

2) If the employee pays the costs, then a wage type starting with 8 must be mapped.

Only here is the wage type selected according to the amount of sales tax.;;;

column1: Adapt custom scripts which set perdiem supression FDFs
column27:
Hello Codebusters,

Following the completion of EXPENG-1019 and EXPENG-1055 the validation and pre processing logic of certain validators is moved to two new mandatory phases. These are always executed before the other custom logic phases.
This has the consequence that the FDFs listed below, which where formerly read in the validation phase by the BasicActualAbsenceListValidator to define per diem suppression on absences, are now are read before any custom script can set or alter them.
This can change the suppression of perdiem and result in errors during statement calculations in affected customer systems.

To mitigate this, at use the setter setSuppressSubsistencePerDiem and setSuppressStatutorySubsistencePerDiem of an absence in the relevant scripts directly, when attaching on of the FDFs listed below on statement or absence level.

Relevant FDFs:
FDF_STATEMENT_NO_ABSENCE_REIMBURSEMENT (value: expense.statement.noAbsenceReimbursement)
FDF_STATEMENT_SUPPRESS_SUBSISTENCE_PERDIEM (value: expense.statement.supressSubsistencePerDiem)
FDF_STATEMENT_SUPPRESS_STATUTORY_SUBSISTENCE_PERDIEM (value: expense.statement.supressStatutorySubsistencePerDiem)
FDF_ELEMENT_NO_REIMBURSEMENT (value: expense.element.noReimbursement)
FDF_ABSENCE_SUPPRESS_SUBSISTENCE_PERDIEM (value: expense.absence.supressSubsistencePerDiem)
FDF_ABSENCE_SUPPRESS_STATUTORY_SUBSISTENCE_PERDIEM (value: expense.absence.supressStatutorySubsistencePerDiem)

Using a query ([^Query.sql]) on the EMS databases on Bali, staging and production found multiple configurations of customer systems listed below where the relevant FDFs where used in scripts.

The table list the system ID, custom logic block start and end dates, custom logic block attributes and hooks as points of reference as to where to find the relevant scripts.
If scripts alter FDFs but do this in the AbsenceList hook and after the BasicActualAbsenceListValidator has been executed, they are not critical but should be adapted to be future proof.

BALI:

[^BALI findings.pdf]

PROD:
[^EMS_AMADEUS_A_export.csv]
[^EMS_MEGA_A_export.csv]
[^EMS_TRAVEL_A_export.csv]

To ease the work on Bali the following list lists the relevant systems names with the corresponding system ID.

column1: ARD / new custom logic needed for receipt type "Own contribution traveler"
column27:
In the ARD system we have configured the receipt type "own contribution traveler".

This type of receipt must always be used by the traveler if he has not started his business trip from his place of residence or his first place of work as this can result in higher costs for ARD.

Therefore the traveler must always obtain 2 offers, one for the start of the business trip from the place of residence or the first place of work and another offer from where the business trio really starts.

The difference between these 2 offers must be entered by the traveler with the receipt type "own contribution traveler" and this amount must then be deducted from the reimbursement amount.

This may also result in negative reimbursement!

It would be a showstopper for ARD if this is not adjusted in Expense since not all statements go to the Auditor (Conditional Workflow).

Actually this is not possible in the EMS (only with script) and therefore we need a custom logic for this behavior. 

These 2 options wold be conceivable for me:

Option 1: display an error message if the amount of this receiot type is entered without a minus in front of the amount,

Option 2: change Debit and Credit in the calculation (40/50) so that it is no longer a liability on the traveler but a demand on the traveler
column221:
20/Feb/23 3:10 PM;mueller;Current workflow in the ARD system: First auditing, then one-step approval!																						
																						
																						
*+Statements with the following criteria always have to go to the Auditor:	+*																					
																						
1. Statements for which the reimbursement to the traveler is greater than EUR 200 (including meal allowances, accommodation allowances, mileage allowances)																						
2. Statements that contain the travel reason "business trip with private part"																						
3. Statements that only include absences from abroad or a mixture of domestic and international absences																						
4. Statements that contain more than 500 kilometers driven (regardless of the type of vehicle)																						
5. Statements that include the following types of receipts: Miscellaneous, Other Charges, Taxi, Boat/Ferry, Hotel/Breakfast																						
6. Statements that include multi-day absences but no meal reductions																						
7. Statements that include the three-month-rule																						
8. 10% spot checks																						
																						
																						
*+Statements with the following criteria always have to go to the Approver:		+*																				
																						
1. Statements for which the reimbursement to the traveler is greater than EUR 24 (including meal allowances, accommodation allowances, mileage allowances)																						
2. Statements that contain the travel reason "business trip with private part"																						
3. Statements that contain paid by company receipts marked as "out of policy".																						
4. Statements containing the following receipt types:																						
other fees																						
rail ticket 1st class with Bahncard																						
rail ticket 1st class without Bahncard																						
rail ticket 2nd class with Bahncard																						
rail ticket 2nd class without Bahncard																						
Bahncard (if marked "to be reimburse" for the traveller)																						
Rental car (if marked on "to be reimburse" to the traveler)																						
Taxi																						
ship/ferry																						
5. Statements in which the receipt type "other costs flight/baggage" is greater than 50 EUR																						
6. If the checkbox "One-day business trip to a location of my broadcaster with canteen service" is activated, then these accounts should not be included in the approval, even if they contain other criteria that actually have to be approved																						
;;;
column222:
20/Feb/23 3:28 PM;gheorghe;[10/02 12:31] Dominik DYKIERTnegative receipt amount
Hello cE engine is it possible to validate that customer is only able to enter negative amounts for one receipt type? otherwise there will be an validation error?
​
[10/02 12:35] Marius HILBICHThere is no such validator available and to be honest this sounds like an advance payment to me.
(1 liked)
​
[13/02 08:12] Martin ROHKAMMFrom a business perspective not necessarily - There are even CC transactions (unassigned sources) coming in with negative amounts(e.g. re-funds from previous transactions/vouchers etc). It is a very real business case ... 
​
[13/02 08:37] Marius HILBICHOk, but then it's maybe justified to introduce a dedicated category for such receipts which should be considered negative.
Because to me it is still odd that you need to add a negative amount.
I don't think your voucher has a negative amount displayed on it.
​
[13/02 08:40] Martin ROHKAMMDepends - there are receipt types that can be both positive and negative (CC transaction re-fund is arriving as the "normal" receipt type e.g. flight, rental car etc ...) or purely negative receipt types (e.g. "voucher") - right now there is no way to distinguish these in the tool - so a negative value is the way to go ( and also from financial standpoint the most correct - it's a negative reimbursement to the traveler)
​
[13/02 08:46] Marius HILBICHOk got it. So not all receipt types which can be negative should be validated to be always negative.
I mean it's an easy validation if it should be standard validator.
(1 liked)
​
[13/02 09:01] Dominik DYKIERTin this case customer if travelers are booking e.g. flight from different places than work place than they have to pay the difference themselves based on a special receipt type which can only be negative and subtracted from reimbursement;;;
column223:
22/Feb/23 5:02 PM;gheorghe;Hi [~mueller] ( cc [~dykiert] )

This scenario was discussed in the board and the custom logic and pm enhancements were rejected. 

This is not a use case meant to be used by an expense management system so we discourage to use a receipt type and any kind of logic like that for this

Also, since there would be no paper receipt for these kind of costs ARD might run into  issues from a tax/external audit point

{+}Solution workaround{+}: What we can suggest is for them to use the cash advance box in order to deduct and since we cannot change the label of the CA then a system text should be added for it to mention that since the label will not be changed.

Disclaimer: it is up to the traveler to determine the amount to be deducted not up to the system as in expense we would not receive 2 bookings but just 1

If they disagree with the solution proposed, then this use case should be handled outside of Cytric Expense ; if the customer complains after this communication Tanja,  bring this up to GAD/CSM/yourself( up to you) and take this further with PM

_Questions to reflect on for ARD when it comes to their processes to optimize them ( not handled in Cytric Expense in any case but maybe is worth for them to reflect on different use case if not done already)_

1/ what if work/residence Hannover - travel to Nice, then would stop in Paris and then travel to Nice after a few days - it is not considered as being the same trip, but 2 separate trips hence the departure is not residence/primary work place - are they not covering the costs of the traveler?

2/a/ How is the traveler going to compare the costs to be able to apply the correct contribution since he will not get the 2 costs in expense, is only an information he can check on travel side. In expense we just know the cost that occur but not the one you need to compare of to be able to deduct anything.

2/ b/ How is the traveler going to compare the costs the costs in time for example because if they would compare at the moment of departure it would not be the same price at the expense statement submission time (the prices in time can be different)

Let me know if something is not clear

Thanks

Andreea;;;

column1: Vaillant -  Automatically overwrite tax rate
column27:
Hello team,

Customers report that the tax rate is automatically overridden.
I had opend the ITE-1601. so Could you please adjust the tax rate on configlation of "fullallowance".

<Root cause>
The behavior is caused by missing tax definition in the Engine
The tax rate on this booking is 'Reduced2' rate visible in the UI which corresponds to technical code 'expense.baseReceipt.taxRate.reduced_4
This rate is defined in Vegas configuration for country SK and PT for receipt type 'expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel'

SK
!image-2023-02-15-10-27-00-034.png!


On Engine side the used configuration is 'fullallowance'. However in those configuration files there is no Accounting Configuration included. Hence, we are taking the information from the default configuration and this one does not have the mentioned tax rate defined.
!image-2023-02-15-10-25-09-862.png|width=1062,height=307!

Tax rate:
!image-2023-02-15-10-26-12-725.png|width=1000,height=526!

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: NO statutory – Update allowances for 2023
column27:
Please update the Norway statutory file as per followings, all effective from {*}01.01.2023{*}.

<Accommodation allowances>

*Update in statutory.properties

expense.NO.perDiems.perDiem.expense.absence.accommodation.hotel={*}{color:#de350b}634{color}{*}

expense.NO.perDiems.perDiem.expense.absence.accommodation.boardingHouse={*}{color:#de350b}177{color}{*}

expense.NO.perDiems.perDiem.expense.absence.accommodation.appartmentBarracks={*}{color:#de350b}98{color}{*}

expense.NO.perDiems.perDiem.expense.absence.accommodation.noDocumentedAccommodation=205 (no change)

 

<Mileage allowances>

The rates in red are those that have been changed.

The limit (Change of rate when driving below or above 10.000 km) was removed several years ago, and the same rate applies regardless how many KM driven, so please update our config for "motorcar", "dirt", "trailer" and "dirt.trailer".

*For other types of vehicles including "troms", please leave them as they are.
|Type of vehicle|Amount per km|
|Motorcar|NOK *{color:#de350b}3.50{color}*|
|Motorbike (up to 125 ccm)|NOK 2.00|
|Motorbike (over 125 ccm)|NOK 2.95|
|Moped|NOK *{color:#de350b}2.00{color}*|
|Snow Mobile|NOK *{color:#de350b}10.00{color}*|
|Electro Car|NOK {color:#de350b}*3.50*{color}|
|Motorboat|NOK 7.50|
|Other|NOK 2.00|
|Passenger rate|NOK 1.00 / passenger|
|Dirt|NOK {color:#de350b}*4.50*{color}|
|Trailer|NOK {color:#de350b}*4.50*{color}|
|Dirt.trailer|NOK {color:#de350b}*5.50*{color}|

 

<Per diem for international trips>

For rates in each country, please refer to the following website:

[https://arbeidsgiver.dfo.no/lonn-goder-og-reise/reise-og-satser/statens-satser-utenlands]

 

<Meal deduction for International (Foreign) trips>
|Meal|Deduction rate|
|Breakfast|{color:#de350b}{*}20{*}{*}%{*}{color} (changed from 10%)|
|Lunch|{color:#de350b}*30%*{color} (changed from 40%)|
|Dinner|50%|

*No change in deduction rate for domestic (home) trips.

!image-2023-02-08-14-57-11-373.png!

 

Effects if the KBV activates the checkbox: No payment of the statutory per diem allowance even if the KBV was on business for more than 8 hours.

 

+Example:+
 # Without {*}Generalized per diem (Status quo){*}:

 

KBV is on business for 7 hours

à no payment of a per diem allowance, if the KBV has received a meal from his employer, the non-monetary remuneration values are displayed to him on the expense report and he must pay tax on these values.

 

KBV is on the road on official business for more than 8 hours

à payment of a per diem allowance of EUR 14 or EUR 28, if the KBV has received a meal from his employer, his per diem allowances are reduced accordingly.

!image-2023-02-08-14-57-44-037.png!
 # With *Generalized per diem*

 

KBV is on business for 7 hours

à no payment of a per diem allowance, if the KBV has received a meal from his employer, the non-monetary remuneration values are displayed to him on the expense report and he must pay tax on these values.

 

KBV is on the road on official business for more than 8 hours

à no payment of a per diem allowance, if the KBV has received a meal from his employer, the non-monetary remuneration values are displayed to him on the expense report and he must pay tax on these values.

column1: [EUT-FR] - Implement  Custom Workflow and Calculations Scripts (EMS)
column27:
*WHY - Business Need*

Eutelsat needs to migrate all the processes they are running today in Traveldoo tool to Cytric Amadeus.

Today in Traveldoo, all the expense not respecting a certain policy, requires an extra level of approval.

Due to the tight timelines, Eutelsat accepted to go live with 1 level approval.

To adapt to their processes with the temporary 1 level of approval , they need to reinforce the audit phase with extra resources. Which means an extra cost.

 

*WHAT - Enhancement specifications*

Go to 

[ERS_EUT_Eutelsat.xlsx|https://amadeusworkplace.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/Corporations-SuccessManagement/Customers/EUTELSAT/2.%20EXTERNAL/3.%20Projects/Wave%201%20(FR)/02.%20Workshops/Expense/ERS_EUT_Eutelsat.xlsx?d=we6b03ca6f146427abbc67d8a1b987233&csf=1&web=1&e=W3aJr6]

 

WorkSheets
 * WORFLOW_CHART_CUST

 

This CI intends to implement in Cytric an specific customer need to address the over-limit expenses to a second level of approval.

It´s composed of both
 * CustomLogic
 * Workflow customization

 

*_CUSTOM LOGIC CONDITIONS_*

_01_VALIDATION_

_A- We need to make sure that the {*}Meals and Hotels receipts{*}, are not over the limit defined in the ERS, if not they´ll get an error message._

_ERR - You need to enable 2nd level of approval to declare Hotel or Meal expenses over the limit._

_For *Hotel* we need to caculate the *amount per night* using a new FDF where the user will indicate the number of nights for that receipt._

_For {*}Meal Invitations{*}, it will be necessary to calculate the {*}amount per participant{*}, cytric has an embeded participants calculator, so no need of extra FDF._

 

_B - We need to make sure that {*}Air and Rail receipts are paid by company{*}, if not they´ll get an error message._

_ERR - You need to enable 2nd level of approval to declare Air or Rail expenses._

_If there is any Air or Rail receipts which needs_  _to be reimboursed we should raise an error at calculation time._

 

_C - In case the {*}user enable the FDF -2nd level of approval{*}, the validation to block the out of policy expenses will be skipped._

_so if_

_FDF_ 2ndApprovalLevel - TRUE - validation skipped - ( workflow 2nd level of approval required)

_FDF_ 2ndApprovalLevel - FALSE (default value) - validation applied 

 

*EXTRA REQUIREMENTS*
 # Change validation error msg forAir-Rail not paid by company
 # Force default workflow to get audit before approval (temporary solution to fix a problem in PROD with standard workflow)
 # Custom Workflow ready in PROD for validations by 10th of March (committed with customer by 20th March)
 # When submitting an statement you are not allowed to move on if you are your own approver. (Recipent/arranger is not the same person as approver AND Rcipent/arranger/approver must not be the same person as auditor)
column221:

A is not currently possible standard but has been acknowledged and accepted by PM to be enhanced in the product

Therefore what you can offer for now to Eutelsat is B& C and say that for A they need to wait for the PM enhancement

For meals there is already a reference, for hotel another one will follow 

Let me know if you need more info

Thanks

I added Approver and Audit validators to EMS setting both on BALI and on PROD

*ExpenseApprovalValidator*

Validates that recipient or arranger must not be the approver and (if not disabled) that the final and restricted approver are not the same person. Otherwise attaches an error.
*ExpenseAuditValidator*
Attaches an error in case the auditor is the same person as the recipient, arranger, restricted approver or final approver.;;;

Hello team,

Could you please update the system text,

Please remove as below,
{code:java}
     <dataFieldDescriptor type="SystemText" code="expenseStatement.receipts.general.topOfTab">
      <nameTranslation>
        <name locale="en_US">System Text: Expense Statement/Receipts</name>
        <name locale="de_DE">System Text: Expense Statement/Receipts</name>
        <name locale="fr_FR">System Text: Expense Statement/Receipts</name>
      </nameTranslation>
      <assignTo>
        <assign type="${CLASS_Section}" />
      </assignTo>
      <values>
        <item value="expenseStatement.receipts.general.topOfTab">
          <name locale="en_US">To declare private expenses which have been accidentally paid with business credit card, proceed as follows: <br/>
            1.        Create a new receipt with the column ‘to be reimbursed’ and the receipt type “Private expenses company credit card” <br/>
            2.        Insert the private used amount as negative value. <br/>
            3.        In the credit card feed item, set the amount to the value which affects the company (at full private use the amount would be 0.00 CHF)</name>
          <name locale="de_DE">Um versehentliche Privatausgaben mit der Firmenkreditkarte zu deklarieren, gehen Sie wie folgt vor.  <br/>
            1.        Legen Sie einen neuen Beleg mit der Rubrik „zu erstatten“ und der Belegart „Privatausgabe Firmenkreditkarte“ an <br/>
            2.        Geben Sie den privat bezogenen Betrag als negativen Betrag ein. <br/>
            3.        Ändern Sie den Betrag in der Belegzeile aus dem Kreditkartenfeed auf die Höhe des Aufwands welcher die Firma betrifft (bei vollem Privatbezug somit auf 0.00 CHF)</name>
          <name locale="fr_FR">Pour déclarer des frais privés qui ont été payés par erreur avec la carte de crédit business, suivez les informations suivantes: <br/>
            1.        Créez un nouveau justificatif avec la colonne « à rembourser » et le type de justificatif « Carte de crédit de l'entreprise de dépenses privées ».  <br/>
            2.        Insérez le montant utilisé privé comme valeur négative. <br/>
            3.        Dans le poste d'alimentation de la carte de crédit, mettez le montant à la valeur qui affecte l'entreprise (en cas d'utilisation privée complète, le montant serait de 0,00 CHF).</name>
        </item>

        <canSee name="ExpenseApproverRestricted" />

        <canSee name="ExpenseAdministrator" />

column1: Identify null checks which need to as well check empty collections
column27:
The following collections have been changed to be empty collections instead, below are search queries and the number of current findings:
 # Meals in Absence
 ## .getMeals( - 1707
 ## \.meals[^\w"] - 141
 # Inter/External participants in Entertainments
 ## .getExternal( - *7143*
 ## \.external[^\w"] - 261
 ## .getInternal( - 1908
 ## \.internal[^\w"] - 282
 # Absences in Statement/Service/TravelElement
 ## .getAbsences( - 4541
 ## \.absences[^\w"] - *27051*
 # Receipts in Statement/Service
 ## .getReceipts( - 5359
 ## \.receipts[^\w"] - *10249*
 # Services in Statement
 ## .getServices( - 0
 ## \.services[^\w"] - 12
 # CalendarDays in Statement
 ## .getCalendarDays( - 1410
 ## \.calendarDays[^\w"] - 684
 # TravelDays in Statement
 ## .getTravelDays( - 0
 ## \.travelDays[^\w"] - 0
 # Trips in Statement
 ## .getTrips( - 473
 ## \.trips[^\w"] - 85
 # Posting Records in Statement
 ## .getPostingRecords( - *16843*
 ## \.postingRecords[^\w"] - 836
 # State Changes in Statement
 ## .getStateChanges( - 1
 ## \.stateChanges[^\w"] - 77
 # Comments in Statement
 ## .getComments( - 0
 ## \.comments[^\w"] - 0
 # Titles in Person
 ## .getTitles( - 0
 ## \.titles[^\w"] - 0
 # Mileage Sums in System User
 ## .getMileageSums( - 1
 ## \.mileageSums[^\w"] - 0

These searches contain a lot of false positives. For example receipt and absence queries contain findings for receipt, meal, accommodation and vehicle type parameters. 
But as long as you can't define a more precise one without potentially missing true positives we will have to check every finding.

column1: ARD / adjustment for "Werbungskosten" on PDF Report / meal deductions
column27:
Please adjust the display of "Werbungskosten" on the PDF report for the  checkbox "Eintägige Dienstreise zu einem Standort meiner Rundfunkanstalt mit Kantine":

If this checkbox is ticket and there is a meal deduction, then this meal or meals must be deducted from the "Werbungskosten" with the statutory meal amounts (20/40/40) and not with the "Sachbezugswerte"

So for this example the "Werbungskosten" must be 2,80 EUR (lunch received) and not 14,00 EUR:
 !image-2023-02-07-09-31-28-224.png|thumbnail!

column1: Unsupported parameter is used
column27:
The parameter *receiptTypeList* of the subactor *PaidByCompanyValidator* has been deprecated some time ago in favor of the parameter {*}receiptTypes{*}.

In engine release 20.4.0 the old parameter has finally been removed and it can be seen in the logs that oebb-test is still using the old parameter and therefore the validator is most likely misbehaving.

Please replace the parameter.

https://es.secure.ifao.net/s/ee/goto/5959bd41fc202f27818b4bbaaa5557a3

column1: [Amadeus GFT Wave 6 Turkey] Per diem calculation is not taking in consideration the other currencies
column27:
Hello Team,

 

It would seem that for all Per diem in Turkey the calculation is wrong.

As a base please look at statement id 13972906

The value itself is okay, but it is shown and calculated in TRY when the Per dieam was in France.

The Per diem for Nice is 65 EUR minus the hotel breakfast we should get 52 EUR. But here we get 52 TRY.

This is not right because 52TRY is around 2.5 EUR

 

!image-2023-02-02-15-04-28-937.png!

 

!image-2023-02-02-15-04-51-962.png!

 

 

Please check and help to fix

Best regards,

Philippe

column1: [Amadeus FACT GFT Wave 6 SG] Some differences between the user report and the auditor report
column27:
h2. *User Story*
h4. As a user in role:  Expense Auditor and Expense User

Hello team,

Customer is in Hypercare for some country.

It was reported a difference between the exchange rate in the user report sent to auditing and the report the auditor is looking at. 

In the example below with the expense report *13988718* on the system

There is a small discrepancy in exchange rate here. On the left side is the report that was approved and is pending for auditing. 

The auditor during his auditing, is checking line by line each receipt and clicked on the "mark as audited". When the auditor do this, the report seems to be recalculated which has generated a new exchange rate. So the total amount is after that different.

 

The customer is not expecting this behavior. I am not sure it is normal. Our understanding with the customer is that once the user submit for approval, so the last calculated by him, the data is fixed and when Auditor checks it does not update it?

This was notified for multiple cases like this

 

Acting User Information: user is: Andy Michaels Kah Wah Lim - username: SG3700285

auditor is: Apisada Kharnchanarom - username: TH2101250

!image-2023-02-07-16-45-13-054.png!
column170:
Server: amadeus
System: ama-es-amadeus
Location: SG - Amadeus GDS Singapore
column221:
06/Feb/23 10:04 AM;pthuaud;Hello Team,

 

I just wanted to update on maybe the issue here.

what is happening is that when the auditor is auditing the receipt and the data is the same day as the auditing. It happens that when the auditor is auditing the item and mark it as audited. The exchange rate is updated when audited.

I suspect since it is the same day that between the time the expense is submitted, approver and audited the exchange rate got updated with teh day value as it was not yet.

If you can confirm this behavior as the customer thinks that the exchange rate is fixed upon submitting the expense and approved by the line manager.

 

Best regards,

Philippe;;;
column222:
14/Feb/23 10:10 AM;pthuaud;Hello [~gmalarski] ,

 

This morning Thailand time, on the amadeus system on the amadeus 1 server, the team create a test claim with ID: 14090749

with a receipt for Feb 13 and another receipt for feb 14th.
when it was created, the exchange rate of the receipt for 14th was the same as the one for 13th which is expected as the rate for the 14th in cytric is not yet updated.

 

They lookat it again in the afternoon, the rate has changed.

The team is saying they did not change or do anything this afternoon.

only me who click on the calculate button.

this claim is not submited yet.

To my understanding, the rate would only update or change if we change the receipt, or click on calculate.

even if we submit the rate will not be updated.

and once it is approve it should not be changed as well...;;;
column224:
23/Feb/23 11:53 AM;pthuaud;Hello Team,

Just adding a message to indicate that from the FACT Wave 6 project, this is the last issue before we can close the hypercare.

If we can try to fix this as soon as possible that would be great.

 

From my understanding, we have a bug, because the exchange rate should not be changed once it is approved after submission.;;;

column1: ARD / add validation rule for private overnight stay
column27:
Actually is it possible to check for all absences the checkbox "private overnight stay". 
That means you can check this chekbox also on the departure day. This makes no sense at all, so please check, if we can configure a validation rule or CL that prevents this behavior and an error message will be displayed when the user checks the checkbox on the departure day. 

Error Message:
Für den Abreisetag darf keine Private Übernachtung geltend gemacht werden! 
No private overnight stay may be claimed for the day of departure!

Please correct the actuall error message for 2 day trips with the same new text!
*
Actually we have this logic already for 2 day trips but: *This logic must apply for all trips longer than one day!*
*
 !image-2023-01-27-12-07-50-638.png|thumbnail!

column1: ARD / activate "forcedMileageUnit.value"
column27:

*forcedMileageUnit.value*

BALI and staging: AMA-Allianz-Test

Location: NL-Allianz Direct Versicherungs-AG, Dutch branch

Hello team,

Please implement receipt types first in Bali and after my verification/approval, we move the changes to staging.
 * Receipts are the same as *DE-Allianz Direct Versicherungs-AG VIP99* (business trip configuration), if you want to save time.
 * The new receipts are in *yellow*
 * Some of the receipts of *DE-Allianz Direct Versicherungs-AG VIP99* are not required in this new location. The receipts that we don't need to include are:
 ** Taxi (for routes up to 50 Km)
 ** Taxi (for routes over 50 km)
 ** MVV fee
 ** Travel agency fee (MVV)
 ** CC fee (MVV)
 * Receipts from *DE-Allianz Direct Versicherungs-AG VIP99* which are entertainment, we need to keep them as they are. There are not new entertainment receipts in the list with the entertainment behavior.
 * Language: only English
 * Tax rates according to the ERS
 * VAT mapping according to the ERS
 * You can ask Maciej Bucko for the ERS automation to test it

column1: [Amadeus GFT - Turkey] Exchange rate of the Central Bank of Turkey (CBT) not used
column27:
h2. *User Story*
h4. As a

{color:#444444}user / approver / {color}

{color:#444444}When doing an expense claim with a foreign currency, the eschange rate to be use first is the CBT (Central Bank of Turkey) which has been setup as per {color}EXPENG-912

However, this is not the case.

my user pthuaud on the system made the statement #14056104 in the test location and the exchange rate used is not the one from CBT.

Exchange rate used is 20.320800 

The exchange rate on CBT is: 20.3329

 

Please check and fix the issue. Also, as a reminder, we do not apply the 4% on top of the exchange rate for all locations of Turkey.

 

I have compared between the exchange rate displayed on Cytric and the one from these 2 end point:

website of the CBT: [TCMB - Indicative Exchange Rates|https://www.tcmb.gov.tr/wps/wcm/connect/en/tcmb+en/main+menu/statistics/exchange+rates/indicative+exchange+rates]

xml link from which Cytric is getting the rate:

[https://evds2.tcmb.gov.tr/service/evds/datagroup=bie_dkdovytl&startDate=17-01-2023&endDate=19-01-2023&type=xml&key=4AKagiakOA|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fevds2.tcmb.gov.tr%2Fservice%2Fevds%2Fdatagroup%3Dbie_dkdovytl%26startDate%3D15-06-2022%26endDate%3D15-06-2022%26type%3Dxml%26key%3D4AKagiakOA&data=05%7C01%7C%7C2729b76d8ad04ab35d3708da53fcf783%7Cb3f4f7c272ce4192aba4d6c7719b5766%7C0%7C0%7C637914643200822603%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=GVyIUQOK5cO3OZR0usnWU30DFZ8UIsv4JYeXDnfoTy4%3D&reserved=0]

 

Best regards,

Philippe

column1: Investigate and fix the script error in the ama-es-ch system on production
column27:
Hello Codebusters,

when I checked our engine logs on kibana prod I noticed the occurrence of multiple rg.graalvm.polyglot.PolyglotException in the ama-es-ch system.

TypeError: invokeMember (setCostCenter) on net.ifao.expense.customScripts.wrapper.PostingRecordWrapper(...)failed due to: Cannot convert '0'(language: Java, type: java.lang.Integer) to Java type 'java.lang.String': Invalid or lossy primitive coercion.

The execption is thrown during the addVehicleDebitPostingRecord method call in the first js script in the ExpenseData hook of the postingRecordGeneration phase in the custom logic configurations in the location country GB.

Please fix the error.
 * System:           ama-es-ch
 * Country:         GB
 * Phase/Hook:   postingRecordGeneration/ExpenseData
 * Subactor:        net.ifao.expense.logic.customSubActors.CustomScriptSubActor
 * KibanaLogs example:
        https://es.secure.ifao.net/s/ee/app/kibana#/doc/3afe1f90-e0e8-11ec-b748-a7b709a9fb27/ee.1-2023.04/doc?id=U4jI5IUBugrCUMgQcxEO&_g=

column1: Porsche - Add "expense.DE.absence.apply24hRule"
column27:
Hello team,

{color:#de350b}*Please implement first only on Porsche Staging System:*{color}
{color:#de350b}*https://staging.cytric.net/env-a/ibe/?system=Porsche-Test*{color}

Could you add "expense.DE.absence.apply24hRule" on calculation.properties.

expense.DE.absence.apply24hRule=true

Customer request:

+Currently:+ For days marked in yellow (user filled in 00:00-24:00) the user calculates the reduced per diem rate (see red marked amount)

{+}Required change{+}: If a user filled in an absence 00:00-24:00 on day of arrival/departure the system should calculate the +full+ per diem (in example 40,00 EUR)

Only if the user filled in an absence between 00:00 – 23:59 the reduced per diem should apply

!image-2023-01-25-17-19-57-731.png|width=753,height=264!

!image-2023-01-25-17-20-06-893.png!

Best regards,
Yutaka

column1: BE Market Template - Per-diem and Overnight allowance rate update for 2023
column27:
KPMG advised that the Belgium regulation for Domestic Per-diem and night allowance has been changed since Sep’17.
Please update the rule and rates as per below, effective from \{*}01.01.2023{*}.

*<Per-diem for domestic trip>*

Previous rule and rates
|Time|Rate|
|> 5 hours and < 8 hours|EUR 3.82|
|More than 8 hours|EUR 19.22|

{color:#de350b}=> Current rule and rates 2023{color}
|{color:#de350b}Time{color}|{color:#de350b}Rate{color}|
|{color:#de350b}> 6 hours{color}|{color:#de350b}EUR 19.99 / day{color}|

*No change in rules and rates for International Per-diem.

 

*<Overnight allowance>*

Previous rule and rates
|If stay overnight|Night allowance|
|If hotel at charge of the employer|EUR 23.04|
|If hotel at charge of the employee|EUR 43.78|

{color:#de350b}=>  Current rule and rates 2023{color}
|{color:#de350b}If stay overnight{color}|{color:#de350b}Night allowance{color}|
|{color:#de350b}If hotel at charge of the employer{color}|{color:#de350b}No longer applicable{color}|
|{color:#de350b}If hotel at charge of the employee{color}|{color:#de350b}EUR 149.99 / night{color}|

column1: MHP: Wage type split for 3M-rule - Showstopper requirement
column27:
Hi colleagues,

We are coming back to you after consultation about the following requirement with MHP which were already raised to you in item #29 and item#31 of your Dashboard:

[https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=Expense&title=Service+Requests+board+tracking|https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=Expense&title=Service+Requests+board+tracking:]

Supporting the requirement within the product was rejected twice. After our consultation with the customer, this requirement must be considered a showstopper as they cannot simply change their expense policy due to several reasons (e.g. work council). 

As we are not able to fulfill the requirement automatically within Cytric Expense, they were requesting to get the taxable per-diems paid within the 3M-rule reported. Getting those values reported, would enable MHP to follow their manual process which is in place and used by MHP currently. After consultation with Marius and Matthias de Vries, we are not able to extract those values out of the Engine by Default. Therefore, we cannot rely on cE Reportings. 

Marius did mention, that with moderate usage of CL, we could manipulate the Engine calculation and split the taxable per-diems paid (e.g. within 3M-rule and everything else). This would allow us to extract those values separately and report those to our customer. 

 

*+Could you please discuss the following:+*

a) The proposal of Marius to manipulate the Engine calculation 

b) Brainstorm about other potential ways on how to report the requested values securely. 

 

Additional information around the 3M-rule and the so-called "Nachtzuschuss" at MHP is stored here: 

[https://amadeusworkplace.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/Corporations-SuccessManagement/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAB96B41D-24E3-44E9-B032-6BEE9E5844FC%7D&file=Copy%20of%20Nachtzuschuss_Beispiel.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=37531957-10bb-41ec-8024-040184ab7735]

 

{color:#de350b}*Please note that this requirement must be considered a showstopper for the project.* {color}

We appreciated any support from your side.

THX

19/Jan/23 8:20 AM;ccasper;Hi [~gheorghe], thanks for sharing the result of the CL-Board - very clear and great news for the project! THX!

Based on the decision, [~mbartz] will request a codebuster to be assigned to follow-up with Marius and Mircea on the CL needed. ;;;

column1: TotalEnergies FR - Implement Custom Calculations Scripts (EMS)
column27:
As per ERS FR - Expense types list and validators sheets the following needs to be activated:
 * Allowed dates: in engine like vegas the start date needs to be 3 years (hence 01.01.2020) back meaning I cannot submit a statement older than 3 years and if I do I am blocked
 * Mandatory attachment (specific receipts to be found in Expense types list)
 * Expense approval validator - net.ifao.expense.validation.expense.all.customValidators.ExpenseApprovalValidator
 * Alter Receipt Exchange Rate 

Acceptance criteria (assumes that everything is done in the test environment):

*Acceptance criteria should be created based on ERS requirements, eg:*
 * system error is thrown when user tries to calculate the expense statement when his statement has a date before 2020
 * system error is thrown when user tries to calculate the expense statement without attachment
 * system error is thrown when user tries to calculate the expense statement when he is submitter and approver
 * alert when the exchange is being modified

column1: TotalEnergies FR - Implement Receipt Types and Accounting (EMS)
column27:
As per ERS

Acceptance criteria (assumes that everything is done in the test environment):

*Acceptance criteria should be created based on ERS requirements, eg:*
 * all receipts codes are the same as in vegas
 * all receipts contain tax rates according to ERS requirements
 * all cost types are implemented according to ERS requirements
 * when subtask Receipt Types and Tax Rate (Vegas) is done user should be able to calculate all receipts with proper tax rates without any errors

column1: TotalEnergies FR - Implement Custom Workflow (Vegas-Expense)
column27:
_LE 27/01 Change scope raised - new requirement as following:_

_Questions: Do we need 2 custom workflows or 1 will suffice?_

_*Please provide new sizing for the new requirement asap*_ 

_1) Some locations have:_

_*Approval step + audit step*_ 

_Approval step needs to be skipped as per details below in point A_

_*=>>>> what is in italic is not yet confirmed and might be not needed - customer is still deciding*_

 

2) Some other locations have: this needs to be considered for NOW 

*Approval step only*

Approval step needs to be skipped as per details below in point A

A. Conditional workflow to skip approval step should take into account following criteria:
 * If there are certain receipts - mobility receipts :AIT/AVI/CG2/EVE/ESS/HOS/HOT/IKM/LOC/PPS/RES/TRA/TRC/TXI/VBI

 ** Entretien et réparation des véhicules
 ** Essence
 ** Gasoil - GPL - Elec,
 ** Location véhicule,
 ** Péage et Parking,
 ** Hôtel (breakfast incl.),
 ** Hôtel,
 ** Avion,
 ** Billets agence voyages regul,
 ** Train,
 ** Transports en commun hors avion et train
 ** Visa / Passeport
 ** Tax
 ** Repas
 ** Indemnités km (carburant compris) -> mileage 
 * there is Cytric Trip ID present at statement level
 * and the sum of the mobility receipts in the expense statement should not exceed 400e

then SKIP APPROVAL step

To consider to other way around:
 * if there is a receipt in the expense statement that is not in the list above then approval should take place
 * if the Cytric Trip ID is missing then approval should take place
 * If the amount of the 1 or all mobility receipts present in the statement exceeds 400e then approval should take place

 

Acceptance criteria (assumes that everything is done in the test environment):

*Acceptance criteria should be created based on ERS requirements, eg:*
 * The expense statement will omit the approval step if the amount of the total expense statement mobility receipts only is less than 400 euros and which are based on a Cytric booking means Cytric trip detail number present
column105: Import to Customer Test System / New

|if there is a receipt in the expense statement that is not in the list above then approval should take place|ok|
|If the amount of the 1 or all mobility receipts present in the statement > 400e then approval should take place|ok|
|If the amount of mileage > 400e then approval should take place|ok|
|if the Cytric Trip ID is missing then approval should take place|ok|
|If the amount of the 1 or all mobility receipts present in the statement = 400e then no approval|ok|
|if there is meal types in the expense statement then approval should take place|nok |

 

If I am adding meal allowance on top of the mobility receipts => approval should take place and now it is skipping approval

If the ES ID which contains mobility receipts regardless of its amount if the meal allowance is added approval should take place and not be skipped

See ES ID 370925

Can you pls correct?

column1: Update the systems oebb and oebb-test
column27:
Hello codebusters,

Following the completion of the issue EXPENG-668 the calculator net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.customCalculators.at.BV_OEBB.ActualAbsenceListCalculator
was enhanced with the additional parameter lastDayHourThreshold with the goal to use it as a replacement of the statutory property 'expense.AT.BV_OEBB.absence.lastDayHourThreshold'


To do this the systems oebb and oebb-test need to be updated with the following steps in filebased and EMS.

 

*1.* Add the parameter lastDayHourThreshold to the calculator net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.customCalculators.at.BV_OEBB.ActualAbsenceListCalculator in the customlogic configuration with the value 3 (current value from the system property)


*2.* Remove the statutory property 'expense.AT.BV_OEBB.absence.lastDayHourThreshold' from the systems

column1: Replace DE.EntertainmentDeductableRateCalculator with new AttendeeBasedDeductibleRateCalculator
column27:
In EXPENG-906 we added a new calculator *AttendeeBasedDeductibleRateCalculator* which replaces the existing DE {*}EntertainmentDeductableRateCalculator{*}.

The new calculator is more flexible which allows to determine non-deductible rate for every attendee combination differently. This covers the requirement from PM-2631.

*Adapt the Custom Logic Configuration in the EMS*
 # replace the deprecated {{net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.DE.basic.entertainments.subCalculator.EntertainmentDeductableRateCalculator}} with the new {{net.ifao.expense.calculation.expense.all.entertainments.subCalculator.AttendeeBasedDeductibleRateCalculator}}
 ## set the values to *attendees* EXTERNAL and MIXED both to a *rate* of 30.

column1: FR Market Template - Updates statutory rates (meal and accommodation) for 2023
column27:
Please update each allowance rates in France Market Template as below, effective from *01.01.2023*

{*}_<_{*}{*}Meal allowance for short distance business trip(absolute_meal_deductions){*}{*}_>_{*}

Lunch or Dinner in a restaurant - {color:#de350b}20.20{color} Eur (was 19.00 Eur)

Lunch or Dinner on working place {color:#de350b}7.10{color} Eur (was 6.70 Eur)

Lunch or Dinner - other {color:#de350b}9.90{color} Eur (was 9.30 Eur)

 

ref: [https://www.urssaf.fr/portail/home/taux-et-baremes/frais-professionnels/indemnite-de-petit-deplacement/repas.html]
h3. *<Accommodation allowance for domestic trip(country_per_diems_fix_values)>*
|*Region*|{color:#de350b}*For the first 3 months*{color}|*Beyond 3 months and up to 24 months*|*Beyond 24 months and up to 72 months*|
|Paris and regions Hauts-de-Seine (92), Seine-Saint-Denis (93) and Val-de-Marne (94)|{color:#de350b}72.50{color}|{color:#172b4d}61.60{color}|{color:#172b4d}50.80{color}|
|Other regions|{color:#de350b}53.80{color}|{color:#172b4d}45.70{color}|{color:#172b4d}37.70{color}|

Currently we only support the rates for the first 3 months, so please apply the rates in {color:#de350b}red{color}.

Ref: [https://www.urssaf.fr/portail/home/employeur/calculer-les-cotisations/les-elements-a-prendre-en-compte/les-frais-professionnels/lindemnite-de-grand-deplacement.html]

-> go to"Indemnité de grand déplacement -> Déplacements en métropole" and click "Retrouvez le barème (Find the scare)" link

column1: dmD: Remove wage type for Sachbezugswerte/ benefits in kind in XML
column27:
Customer dm-drogeriemarkt chose the following option in regards to the handling of Sachbezugswerte/ benefits in-kind:

[https://confluence.secure.ifao.net/display/EXPDLY/Sachbezugswerte] 

!image-2023-01-05-08-59-07-732.png!

 

 

 

Currently, the SBZ/ benefits in kind are correctly displayed with amount 0,00 EUR in the PDF report but trigger a wage posting on "7091". Wage type "7091" is for "Kennzeichen M" exclusively. Customer did not provide any wage type for "Lohnversteuerung Mahlzeiten/ wage taxation meals". Please ensure that SBZ/ benefits in kind do not trigger any wage posting or ensure that no wage type is transferred via the posting in the XML.

 

!image-2023-01-05-08-57-32-078.png|width=1347,height=312!

 

!image-2023-01-05-09-14-36-055.png!

          <item value="4_Paragraph" displayOrder="4">
            <name locale="en_US">HUGO BOSS is required by tax law to conduct regular internal audits. Due to this obligation, you must carefully store your original receipts for up to three months after reimbursement of the travel expense statement. ravel Management must be able to request original receipts from all incoming travel expense statements on a random basis in order to check the receipts for authenticity and thus comply with tax digitization requirements. Sending the original receipts to Travel Management is therefore only necessary upon explicit request.</name>
            <name locale="en_GB">HUGO BOSS is required by tax law to conduct regular internal audits. Due to this obligation, you must carefully store your original receipts for up to three months after reimbursement of the travel expense statement. ravel Management must be able to request original receipts from all incoming travel expense statements on a random basis in order to check the receipts for authenticity and thus comply with tax digitization requirements. Sending the original receipts to Travel Management is therefore only necessary upon explicit request.</name>
            <name locale="fr_FR">HUGO BOSS is required by tax law to conduct regular internal audits. Due to this obligation, you must carefully store your original receipts for up to three months after reimbursement of the travel expense statement. ravel Management must be able to request original receipts from all incoming travel expense statements on a random basis in order to check the receipts for authenticity and thus comply with tax digitization requirements. Sending the original receipts to Travel Management is therefore only necessary upon explicit request.</name>
            <name locale="de_DE">HUGO BOSS ist steuerrechtlich verpflichtet regelmäßige interne Auditprüfungen durchzuführen. Aufgrund dieser Verpflichtung musst Du Deine Originalbelege bis drei Monate nach Erstattung Deiner. Reisekostenabrechnung sorgfältig aufbewahren. Das Travel Management muss stichprobenartig Originalbelege aus allen eingehenden Reisekostenabrechnungen anfordern können, um die Belege auf Echtheit zu überprüfen und um somit die steuerlichen Digitalisierungsvorgaben einzuhalten. Ein Versand der Originalbelege an das Travel Management ist daher nur nach expliziter Bitte notwendig.</name>
          </item>

column1: Allianz-AU: Add settings for Amex GM1025 to Expense configuration
column27:
Dear colleagues,

Please do the following changes to the Expense configuration for customer Allianz:

+*1) In system configuration please add the below:*+

 
{code:java}
<creditCardFeed identifier="006000000741181"                                     
creditCardNumberMatchEnabled="true"                                
paidByCompanyDefaultsTo="false"                      
paidByCompanyBillingTypes="00000">
</creditCardFeed> {code}
 

+*2) In location configuration for location* *{color:#de350b}AU-Allianz Technology SE Australia Branch, Sydney{color}* *please add the below:*+

 
{code:java}
<receiptTypeMappings identifier="006000000741181">  

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="HT" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.hotel" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="CR" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.car.fuel_parking_tool" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="PA" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.car.fuel_parking_tool" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="FU" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.car.fuel_parking_tool" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="FL" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.flight" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="TX" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.transport.taxi.business" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="TL" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.transport.taxi.local" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="RA" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.transport.taxi.local" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="TF" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.car.private.fuel_parking_tool" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="TA" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.ticket.flight" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="FO" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.entertainment.employees.outside_office" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="ED" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.employee.training_or_seminar.fee" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="PM" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.employee.membership" />

<mapTransactionToReceipt fromTransactionType="PA" toReceiptType="expense.basereceipt.receipt.allianz.car.private.fuel_parking_tool" /> {code}
 

For detailed information on how to do the implementation in the expense configuration, please check the attached document.

|*Mastercard*|employeeId|userIdentificationEnrichmentCode="PERSONALID" userIdentificationFdfCode="TMS FDF Code" |paidByCompanyBillingTypes="C"|
|*Amex TMKD*|employeeId|userIdentificationEnrichmentCode="REF1", userIdentificationFdfCode="TMS FDF Code"|paidByCompanyDefaultsTo="true"|
|*Visa*|CC Number|creditCardNumberMatchEnabled="true"|paidByCompanyBillingTypes="C"|
|*Amex GM1025*|CC Number|creditCardNumberMatchEnabled="true"|paidByCompanyBillingTypes="00022“ (if PBC default to  Y)
paidByCompanyBillingTypes="00000“|;;;

 * Receipts in red are actually allowances so do not add them as receipt types
 * 'Meals with guest' should be set as entertainment
 * The list of receipts differs per location hence each location should also be present in Bali ( take location names setup from each sheet tab / customers data sheet)
 * The translations for the receipts are in Expense types list so make sure the translations are also present in each location
 * The table of accounts column is actually intended to be for the posting text so it is not to be considered in the vegas config

Acceptance criteria (assumes that everything is done in the test environment):

*Acceptance criteria should be created based on ERS requirements, eg:*
 * all receipts codes are the same as in EMS
 * all receipts contain tax rates according to ERS requirements
 * when Receipt Types and Accounting (Vegas) is done user should be able to calculate all receipts with proper tax rates without any errors

column1: TotalEnergies FR - Implement DFD and Custom FDF (Vegas)
column27:
Please consult the Cytric Setup up page and FDF so far in order to set up at system level for the time being

please comment the setup and add vegas start date 01/01/2020

please deploy only in Bali for now, when ready for UAT shall be deployed in prod too

 

DFDs recap which can also found in ERS, pls check first ERS as main reference:
 * TimeOuts
 * Hidden Sections
 * OCR
 * Exchange Rate
 * Standard XML
 * SFTP
 * Certified Scanning ( + vegas export piece)

LE 13/01: in case was missed, we have also in the 'Validation rules' sheet 2 vegas specific alerts
 * Out of policy - TPA reason & code

LE 17/01:

Add also includeBusinessUnit approver = false 

Enable Link & merge functionality + with it together add the trip detail number ( no need to be shown as FDF in the UI)

Acceptance criteria (assumes that everything is done in the test environment):
 * All requested DFD and custom FDFs are created according to ERS requirements
 * All requested DFD and custom FDFs are deployed in the test environment
 * All requested DFD and custom FDFs are verified by the reporter

column1: GRE: update perdiem and mileage rates
column27:
Per diem values should be updated (domestic values) just for location {*}‘ES - Red Eléctrica Infraestructuras de Telecomunicación, S.A.U’{*}, as well as the mileage values.

 

1-In the table below, you can see the current values (from May 2020) and the values that should apply from *January 1{^}st{^}* onwards, in relation to the per diems. These values should be updated for configuration ‘daily allowances’:
|*Working day*|*May_20 (current)*|*Jan_23 (update)*|
|BREAKFAST|5,24 €|5,34 €|
|LUNCH|29,25 €|29,78 €|
|DINNER|26,11 €|26,58 €|
|ACCOMMODATION|39,15 €|39,86 €|

 
|*Non-working day*|*May_20 (current)*|*Jan_23 (update)*|
|BREAKFAST|5,24 €|5,34 €|
|LUNCH|37,59 €|38,27 €|
|DINNER|26,11 €|26,58 €|
|ACCOMMODATION|39,15 €|39,86 €|
 
 

 

2- For the mileage, these are the values that should apply from *January 1{^}st{^}* in location {*}‘ES  Red Eléctrica Infraestructuras de Telecomunicación, S.A.U’{*}. These ** values should be updated for configurations ‘daily allowances’ and ‘receipts’:

|*1 passenger*|0,49€/km|0,44€/km|

column1: HeidelbergCement - Converted amount is not delivered in the export
column27:
Dear Team,

Heidelberg Cement complain that in their export the converted amount is not delivered.

I asked to ITE-1490 and the root cause is the custom scripted posting record generator. There is a bug in the script for the handling of present receipts. 

Please fix the script (use converted amount/add the exchange rate to the used amount).

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra

column1: ProcuRX-Jifiti - Invalid target currency of exchange rate
column27:
Could you please adjust the "expense.currency"
h2. current issue:

Customer get the error for "{*}Invalid target currency of exchange rate"{*}
I found the past same EMS issue case. ITE-882/CI-7777

The "home currency" is always determined by

1) the currency in the TMS of the location of the user (see screenshot below) 
2) the currency in the EMS/Engine configuration from the statutory properties settings (Could not check cause of missing Access/EMS Superadmin role)

If 1) and 2) mismatch usually the observed error is shown.

!image-2022-12-27-14-46-16-611.png!

Example:
#10109325 Created 17NOV22 22:21
user: *nick.kappler@jifiti.com*
*location: JIFITI USA, Columbus*

 # please fix issue

There is a meal validator that can help here meaning that if we put the start day to be at 13:00 for example and the itinerary starts before 13:00 and breakfast is deducted  then the user will get an error and be blocked 

however if the itinerary is after 13:00 the user will be able to deduct breakfast so to me this is partially meeting the customer needs

They should instruct the users to deduct/not deduct when applicable as all customers do and for the approver/auditor check if the behavior is correct

If not clear, let me know either via Teams or by making sure to switch back to the correct label as otherwise I will not see ur comment/ticket

Thanks

Andreea;;;
column222:
11/Jan/23 3:00 PM;salajan;Hi [~nsanchez] 

A quick comment from my side about the end time there:

!image-2023-01-11-14-59-48-755.png!

This means, the trip ended on the 20th at midnight exactly. So, on the 21st there were zero minutes of travel, which is why no meals are displayed.

Unfortunately, meals are displayed per day, either all or none. We cannot display only some of the meals. If there is at least 1 minute of travel on a given day, all meals are displayed.;;;

column1: EH:increase custom script size limitation/ITE-1475
column27:
dear team as per ITE-1475 please :
code into the custom script a size limitation, for warning messages

ref:

+*ssue as reported:*+

Generic error on a specific statement during calculate action

+*Labels:*+

SAExp:iConf - the statement is inoperable by invalid configuration

+*Root Cause:*+

Multiple warning fields are stored in this statement wit too-large-content. This specifc case resembles ITE-1178. A field non-existing in ce-core is returned by the engine. Thus it is stored as Link. Links have a size limit in the Database smaller than the content:

!_SA_NG Error_Link too long.png|thumbnail!

Above the corresponding NG error.

Here is the Engine calculation response: [^13181003_response.xml]

In short - the calculate is functioning, but ce-core is not able to store the result, cause the result contains too many characters for the link.

The issue is caused by changing the configuration of the warnings FDF retrospectively during the lifetime of this statement.
column221:
27/Dec/22 10:49 AM;nsanchez;client:

hank you for your feedback. This is really strange and unfortunately I don't know exactly what you mean. 
Regarding the warning field, we already had 2 or more tickets in the past and also had the character limit of this field changed from 240 characters to 1500 characters. ( for e.g. 2-16673277933 or 2-16382386753) I have now informed the affected user that this expense statement is unfortunately broken and can not be repaired. He will create the expense statement completely new and deletes the broken one. 
I hope that in the future similar cases due to the same backgrounds do not occur again. This is depending on the enormous effort for the user. ;;;

column1: Hugo Boss - Add new FDF called "Destination"
column27:
Dear Team,

Hugo Boss ask to add a mandatory FDF called "destination" in the statements and this information must be available in the E021.

 

As you can see in the screen shot below, they sent two proposal and I assume that the second one is the most easy to implement:

 

!image-2022-12-22-14-15-22-201.png|width=388,height=390!

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
column221:
10/Jan/23 10:20 AM;mstaszek;Hello [~ssanz] :)

First proposal is not possible in our product.

Second proposal is possible but we need more information:
 * What kind of field we should implement for "multiple destinations" ?
 * Please clarify what destinations should be available in the field. (should be list in vegas configuration, csv file upload, free text)

Thank you!;;;
column222: 12/Jan/23 11:05 AM;ssanz;Question ask to the customer. I'm coming back to you as soon as I have feedback. BR, Sandra;;;
column224:
23/Jan/23 5:26 PM;mstaszek;Hello [~wenner]  :)

I think what Sandra meant in point *2* was -> Add FDF in TMS and add values (country names) in *CSV file,* this way customer has all control over country available in list both travel / expense.
This will be transferred to expense as a list of countries to select from (dropdown) - thanks to "from.fixed.list" tag in configuration.

And "tick" I think is the wrong word used there - imply check-boxes and customer may think multiple choice FDF is possible - it's not :(  
I would you SELECT from list (only one value can be selected)

so the difference between 1st and 2nd option is *(1st)* list in vegas configuration maintained by us and *(2nd)* list in TMS in csv file maintained by customer.

This part clarify my question -> _Please clarify what destinations should be available in the field. (should be list in vegas configuration, csv file upload, free text)_
I am still missing answer to -> What kind of field we should implement for "multiple destinations" ?

as they proposed:

!image-2023-01-23-17-04-20-254.png!


so the option is free text like Sandra proposed in point 3 but she put it as 3rd choice to fist FDF? - I think there was some misunderstanding there

As I understood from their proposal they want to have 2 FDF:

- First called "Destination" -> here we implement point 1 or 2 from Sandra proposals
- Second called "Multiple Destination" -> here point 3. from Sandra proposal (value should be available in E021) *OR* we can have checkbox so true/ false value and they put countries in expense statement description field.

If you need any more clarification please let me know.

Thank you!;;;

column1: Allianz - Text in the Expense reminder email (related with CI-5816 and CI-6193)
column27:
Dear Team,

This CI is related to CI-5816 and CI-6193.

Allianz asks to add a text at the expense reminder emails (Notification for unsettled trips) but only for all German Locations.

I advise Allianz that the text can only add at the end of the email and it's okay for them.

 The text is the following:

German:

Seit dem 01.01.2020 sind der Travel und Expense Organizer im Sinne einer „End-to-End-Lösung" technisch miteinander verbunden. Somit werden nach der Buchung einer Dienstreise automatisch die vorhandenen Daten aus der Reisebuchung (z.B.: Hotelübernachtungen, Bahnfahrten, Flüge etc.) in das Reisekostenabrechnungstool übertragen.

Diese Buchungen sind dann für Sie im Abrechnungstool jeweils unter dem Reiter Kostenabrechnungen als „Meine Kostenabrechnungen" oder auch als „Kostenabrechnungen für Dritte" in der Arrangerrolle als „nicht zugewiesene Ausgaben" ersichtlich.

„

Dabei müssen Sie zunächst den Beleg anhaken und anschließend auf „Kostenabrechnung erstellen" klicken.  Danach sind die Belege der Kostenabrechnung zugeordnet.

Sollten Sie bereits Ihre Reisekostenabrechnung ohne diese Belege angelegt haben, müssen Sie diese nachträglich einreichen. Hierzu erstellen Sie bitte eine neue Reisekostenabrechnung mit den Belegen unter „nicht zugewiesene Ausgaben". In dieser tragen Sie bitte im Feld „Referenz Expense ID" die Reisenummer der ersten Reise ein. Sie müssen damit auch kein erneuten Reiseverlauf eintragen.

 

English:

Since 01.01.2020 the Travel and Expense Organizer are technically connected with each other for the purpose of an "End-to-End-Solution". This means, that after booking a business trip  all data from the Travel Organizer (e. g. overnight stay at a hotel, train journeys, flights etc.) will be automatically transferred to the Expense Organizer.

Those bookings are then available in the Expense Organizer under the tab called „My Expense Statements" or also under „Expense Statements" in the arranger role as „ unassigned expenses".

"

Thereby you have first to select the respective receipt and click the button „Create expense statement". Subsequently the receipts are assigned to the expense statement.

In case you already have created your expense statement without those receipts, you have to submit those ones retrospectively. Concerning this please create a new expense statement with the receipts listed under „unassigned expenses". Then please enter your trip number from the first journey in the field „reference expense ID". So you don´t have to enter the itinerary once again.

 

Thank you.

Best regards,

Sandra
